availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Frederick Armor (Baltimore, Md, lieutenant and qm (U.S.A.))

body.p: Baltimore, Maryland, merchant and soldier. Maryland native. Married to Emily A.D. Armor. Father of Emily A.D. Armor and Charles G. Armor. Merchant in Baltimore, Maryland, in 1850. Served in the 2nd Maryland Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant and regimental quarter master from July 9, 1861, to January 5, 1865. Post quartermaster and acting assistant quartermaster at Frankfort, Kentucky from January to October 1864.

ab.bibl:
Compiled military service records of volunteer Union soldiers belonging to units organized for service from the State of Maryland, NARA RG 94, Mircofilm Series M384, Roll 076.
Find A Grave, "George Frederick Armor (1820-1897)," Memorial #116569391 http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/116569391 (accessed July 10, 2019).
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Maryland, Baltimore, Baltimore Ward 16, p. 174A.
